openEHR_Naam: Medication order
Commentaar: GebruiksInstructie and Medicatieafspraak share the same root archetype. “Medication item” variable is mandatory (In Medicatieafspraak, we define this variable as “ProductCode” from FarmaceutischProduct). Other openEHR archetypes could fit this ZIB, e.g., openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.medication_summary.v1, openEHR-EHR-ACTION.medication.v1.

openEHR_Naam: Additional instruction
Overall directions description
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing - non-daily/Timing description
Commentaar: Had difficulties to map this variable. Only a text is allowed. The variable is inside Doseerinstructie which has an occurrence of 0..*.

openEHR_Naam: Route
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing - non-daily/Timing description
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Direction duration
Commentaar: ZIB: “In the case of medication for an indefinite period, the dosing duration is left empty in the last dosing instruction.”. In openEHR, we can use an internal coded text (at0067, Indefinite, The direction should be continued indefinitely) instead of leaving the field empty.

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Direction sequence
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/

Commentaar: Can’t select “Interval: Quantity” type in openEHR for this variable

ZIB_Verwijzing: Dit is een verwijzing naar het rootconcept van de bouwsteen TijdsInterval.
openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/Administration duration
Commentaar: The exact date/time (according to TijdsInterval ZIB) is translated as Interval: Duration (upper/lower) in openEHR.

ZIB_Verwijzing: Dit is een verwijzing naar het rootconcept van de sub-bouwsteen Bereik.

Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Additional details/Conditional medication instructions/
Commentaar: This concept is quite complex to map, the definition in the wiki page of the ZIB is not very clear

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Additional details/Conditional medication instructions/Condition rule/Condition
Commentaar: Occurrence for criterium can’t be 0..*, but its parent “Condition rule” is set to 0..*.

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Additional details/Conditional medication instructions/Condition rule/Dose amount
Commentaar: The descriptions in the ZIB and openEHR don’t fit exactly (do we need to record a time??). Other option in openEHR: Medication safety/Maximum dose.

openEHR_Naam:
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/Timing – daily/
+ Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing – non-daily/
Commentaar: In this archetype, we need to separate daily and non-daily dosage: Daily dosage are stored under the ‘Dosage’ CLUSTER archetype, while ”Timing details which are not within a single day, for example, weekly or monthly timings, are carried in the CLUSTER 'Timing - non-daily' archetype carried within the CLUSTER 'Therapeutic direction' archetype.”.

ZIB_Verwijzing: Dit is een verwijzing naar het rootconcept van de sub-bouwsteen Bereik.
openEHR_Naam:
Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/Timing – daily/Frequency
+ Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing - non-daily/Days per time period
openEHR_Type:
QUANTITY + INTERVAL: QUANTITY
+ QUANTITY + INTERVAL: QUANTITY

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing - non-daily/Specific day of week
Commentaar: The occurrences are set to 0..7 in this archetype.  We choose to keep the internal coded list in openEHR.

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/Timing - daily/Timing description
Commentaar: Can’t edit occurrences from 0..1 to 0..* which can lead to issue if multiple timing needs to be inserted. So, we decided to follow openEHR variable description about using an unstructured text: “Text description of the daily timing. This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for different timings without necessarily specifying the timings in a structured way.”

openEHR_Naam: Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Dosage/Timing - daily/Specific time
Commentaar: choose Any time format in openEHR.

+ Structured dose and timing directions/Therapeutic direction/Repetition timing/Timing - non-daily/Repetition interval
